title: The New Global Order
content: As the post-Cold War era recedes, a more regional and competitive order is reasserting itself. Under these conditions, it is not surprising that larger powers would seek to shape their immediate surroundings – not only out of ambition, but also because they face constraints farther afield.
creator: Nancy Qian
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Will Capping Credit-Card Interest Rates Help Ordinary Americans?
content: The federal cap on credit-card interest rates that US President Donald Trump has proposed would, in theory, prevent issuers from gouging customers. But not everyone agrees that this would be good for Americans, especially lower-income households that are often the most desperate for credit.
creator: Jeffrey Frankel
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Those Who Most Need to Understand AI Don’t Get It
content: While anyone familiar with past technological hype cycles can see that today’s predominantly young technologists are overly optimistic about AI’s potential benefits, mainstream economists seem to suffer from tunnel vision of a different sort. If recent history is any guide, that should worry us all.
creator: Charles Ferguson
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: India’s Game-Changing Digital Money Model
content: Over the past decade, India has built the world’s largest real-time payments system. By using public infrastructure to expand financial inclusion, it offers a model for other developing countries that want to modernize payments without being dependent on a few multinational corporations.
creator: Rishi Suri
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: AI and the Global South’s Next Leap Forward
content: The next phase of the clean-energy revolution will be led not by those who build more solar panels, but by those who modernize their grids, markets, and institutions accordingly. In fact, AI-ready grids will be as crucial to the Global South’s development as traditional infrastructure like roads and ports.
creator: Nandan Nilekani
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Rubio’s Silk-Stocking Diplomacy
content: The future that the US Secretary of State touted at this year’s Munich Security Conference is not a vision of something to be built. It is the past projected forward, sugar-coating its racism with appeals to the shared “Christian faith” and “ancestry” that supposedly define the transatlantic bond.
creator: Stephen Holmes
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: India’s Path From Energy Dependence
content: Now that geopolitical wrangling increasingly shapes international trade dynamics, India must reduce its dependence on imported energy to maximize its strategic autonomy. While it could invest more in hydrocarbons, the far better option is to become a renewables-powered electro-state.
creator: Navneeraj Sharma
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Science Alone Won’t Stop Lassa Fever
content: Three promising Lassa fever vaccine candidates are in clinical development, one of which could be licensed in the next decade. But to ensure a swift and effective rollout, West African countries must start planning now to determine who should receive it, how to deliver it, and how to finance and regulate it.
creator: Oyeronke Oyebanji
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Elon Musk’s $1.25 Trillion Mirage
content: More often than not, share prices are rigged, which is why they are a dreadful predictor of profitability even on average, and why they have become the primary instrument for transferring wealth upwards. The SpaceX-xAI merger tells much of this sorry tale.
creator: Yanis Varoufakis
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The Hidden Risks of Simplifying US Bank Supervision
content: The Federal Reserve has recently begun to overhaul its approach to bank oversight, raising the bar for enforcement and leaning more heavily on data-driven tools. These changes could impede regulators’ ability to identify emerging risks at a time when the US financial system faces hidden losses and structural weaknesses.
creator: Amit Seru
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Mexico’s Grim Development Prospects
content: Mexico's low and falling growth is not the result of macroeconomic instability, a lack of investment, insufficient labor, or poor export performance. Rather, it stems from low productivity, an unnecessarily large informal sector, and the ruling party's persistent failure to address the problem.
creator: Santiago Levy
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Make America Trustworthy Again
content: The international order could still avoid a full rupture, but even temporary breaks leave lasting scars. By weaponizing tools designed to manage the global economy through international coordination, President Donald Trump is undermining US credibility and pushing allies to diversify away from American markets – perhaps permanently.
creator: Ricardo Hausmann
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Integration Is Africa’s Only Way Forward
content: Only a more united Africa can avoid “diversified dependency,” whereby primary commodities still dominate exports even as trade shifts eastward toward China and India. Heads of state and government convening in Addis Ababa for an African Union summit on February 14-15 must address the continent’s legacy of fragmentation in a new way.
creator: Hippolyte Fofack
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: When Mining Companies Leave, African Communities Pay
content: For decades, multinational mining companies have extracted tens of billions of dollars in profits across Africa, while sidestepping environmental and fiscal costs and leaving host communities to foot the bill. Without reliable accountability mechanisms, the clean-energy transition risks following the same trajectory.
creator: Christopher Rutledge
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Trump the Rebel King
content: As a chief law-enforcement officer who has deployed gangs of criminal thugs to opposition-led cities and sued a government agency that he oversees for $10 billion, US President Donald Trump has taken the exercise of power to its most absurd extreme. He rules a state that he seeks to destroy.
creator: Slavoj Žižek
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: NATO’s Next Test
content: If NATO is serious about managing the Russian threat identified in its own strategy documents, it must focus its efforts where deterrence is most fragile. Lithuania's plans for a new training ground near the Suwałki corridor are thus a test case for assessing US and European resolve.
creator: Agnia Grigas
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: The Future of American Hegemony
content: Political elites across the ideological spectrum agree that US President Donald Trump’s attacks on democratic institutions mark a historical turning point. Yet despite the chaos that has defined his second presidency, the foundations of America’s economic hegemony remain largely intact.
creator: Jonathan Levy
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Europe Must Make AI Firms Pay for Training Data
content: AI summaries and chatbots are siphoning traffic from news sites, but the current process for demanding compensation – suing tech firms – is slow, expensive, and unfair. The European Union must act now to implement a fixed payment scale, before more media outlets go under and tech firms become too powerful to regulate.
creator: Anya Schiffrin
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: India’s Government Must Defend Taxpayers, Not Foreign Investors
content: Foreign companies have reaped enormous profits from India’s fast-growing digital economy while paying little or no tax by channeling investments through offshore entities. A landmark Supreme Court ruling challenges this model, but the government’s trade agenda pulls in the opposite direction.
creator: Jayati Ghosh
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page

title: Could a BRICS Currency Work?
content: Economists have long dismissed the idea that a BRICS common currency could challenge the US dollar's role in the global economy, and for good reason. But that doesn't mean there couldn't be new common rails for settling trade between countries that want to escape the long arm of the US government.
creator: Jim O'Neill
sourceDescription: Project Syndicate - The World’s Opinion Page
